settings_sections.title: Connect with Pipedrive
settings_sections.description: Please begin by authenticating this connector with Pipedrive. You must have appropriate privileges to grant access. Hull accesses to only the endpoint required to do User and Account synchronization

settings_sections.title: User - Identity
settings_sections.description:
Identity is one of the most important concepts in Hull. The field mapping for user identity should correspond to unique fields across systems. This identity applies to both the data we send to Pipedrive as well as the data we pull from Pipedrive. To read more about identity resolution please click [here](https://help.hull.io/hc/en-us/articles/360030051471 "Identity Resolution Explained")

Email is typically a fairly stable identifier, but can be vulnerable to edge cases. Ideally there is an unique identifier (external_id) that can be used across systems. Try to configure the identity before doing anything else. Changes to the identity after the data flow is already setup could result in irreconcilable scenarios.

Please be aware that Pipedrive rejects user emails with the domain of the customer as well as pipedrivemail.com domains.

settings_sections.title: User - Fetching from Pipedrive
settings_sections.description:
Hull gives its customers the ability to capture a subset of user fields in order to have fine grain control over the dataflow. Please configure the fields that you would like pulled from Pipedrive below.

Add a mapping by clicking "Map an attribute". To create a new attribute in Hull, you may type in the attribute name in the "Hull Attribute" box on the right and hit enter to create a new attribute.

settings_sections.title: User - Sending to Pipedrive
settings_sections.description:
Configuring this section will result in automated data flows which will update your users in Pipedrive. That's why we provide fine grain control over the updates that you send to Pipedrive. First configure a "Segment" as a user filter to control which users get sent to Pipedrive. Then configure the attributes you want synchronized. You may always go to a user page and click "Send to" in order to override the filter and send specific users manually.

Please be careful to map similar data types. ie. Not boolean to date

settings_sections.title: Account - Identity
settings_sections.description:
Identity is one of the most important concepts in Hull. The field mapping for account identity should correspond to unique fields across systems. This identity applies to both the data we send to Pipedrive as well as the data we pull from Pipedrive. To read more about identity resolution please click [here](https://help.hull.io/hc/en-us/articles/360030051471 "Identity Resolution Explained")

Domain can be a good identifier, but be careful because Hull will use the normalized top level domain to match with other accounts. Ideally there is an unique identifier (external_id) that can be used across systems. Try to configure the identity before doing anything else. Changes to the identity after the data flow is already setup could result in irreconcilable scenarios.

Please be aware that Pipedrive will reject accounts sent without a name
